title: Edward's Projects 2026
status: I'm currently converting this site from a gray design in Nuxt to a modern dark design in Next.js.

categories.shortInfo: this site (the site you're viewing) shows all tech projects I'm working on with links to repositories, many useful showcases and templates

title: Comprehensible Input
status: I currently use this site everyday, creating a story with AI based on phrases I have looked up the previous day in Google translate. I'm currently building in features to improve the site and the ability to learn languages more efficiently.

categories.shortInfo: I use this site to learn languages, I read stories aloud that AI creates for me based on Google Translate phrases I look up
This is a site that I have been using for years to combine (1) learning tech skills, and (2) learning languages.
a very old site that I used to learn Spanish, the only useful part to salvage is the color-conjugation chart
this will be a class or hook (TypeScript) that I can include in the front or back in of Datapod projects to parse outline markdown text with images
you can find 10-15 versions of the Datapod concept on this page, with numerous backend languages and frontend frameworks
I used this site to learn Spanish in 2022 and Dutch in 2024, a useful site for learning verbs in these languages, but not currently being developed
A parked site that has the parsing algorithm of my main Italian notes file, so useful for that.
An old site that has the parsing algorithm of my main Italian notes file, so will keep it around until I upgrade my central language site.

I stopped using this in 2025 but still use it to [demonstrate Datapod concepts](https://tanguay-eu.vercel.app/howtos/906) and it still creates the JSON file for my post-2023 [running site](https://edward-tanguay-eu.vercel.app/runs).
this was a quick site I made to save notes in Datapod format, I still use it occasionally for e.g. trips I go on to have all info on my smart phone
this is my personal site, mostly just links for me, a fitness exercise GIF, and a place to record runs I do with photos
